intro: Arrojadoa rosenbergeriana, commonly known as the Rosenberger's arrojadoa, is a rare flowering plant native to the highlands of Ecuador. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments and has a compact, shrub-like structure. Its leaves are ovate with a hairy texture, and it produces capsule fruits that contain small, dark seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
